item.title: 20161209 UT MAT240: Friday Session
item.dc:creator: umu
item.description:
Team,

I hope you are having a productive exam period. For your interest, there are past MAT240 exams from various sources published on the ut.umu page in the MAT240 Resources section.

With 3 people who have answered (thank you, Lola, Matthew and Vanessa), I wonder if we wish to meet today, as usual, at 16:10 in Bahen, B026 (seminar room), for a practice session.

Could you please tell me if this time suits you? Do you have any suggestions, wishes or any secret longings regarding the session you would like to share?

I am looking forward to hearing from you.

Good luck to all of you who have an exam today!

Onwards!

— sasha

item.title: UT MAT240: Preparation for the Final | Arrangements
item.dc:creator: umu
item.description:
Team,

Thank you to all of you who have replied!

Lola has expressed the options nicely:

  • Not on a weekend, and
  • Either of: – On a Friday, or – One, but not both, of: — On a Tuesday, xor — Before 3:30pm

[ ~(weekend) ] ∧ [ (Friday) ∨ [ (Tuesday) ⊻ (Before 3:30pm) ] ]

I know also that there are exams some of us have on December 14 and 15, so December 13 to 15 including are probably not the best days to hold the session.

Unless you have already done so, could you please tell me whether you are interested in meeting up at any time noted above?

I am looking forward to hearing from you.

Have a productive day!

— sasha

item.title: UT MAT240: Preparation for the Final
item.dc:creator: umu
item.description:
Team,

Thank you to all of you who came last Friday. Even though we broke up into two groups working in different rooms, I hope it was productive for you. On my part, I am sorry if I failed to secure a good space for us all – the list of rooms showed that B026 was busy during our session.

I am writing to elaborate on our plan of preparation for the final.

Since all the regular lectures are finished or going to be finished this week, I wonder whether we want to organize joint preparation sessions before December 17. I know that some people solve problems together anyway, and I would be glad if we could join our efforts.

If you are up for the idea, could you please write me a short email with the days and time periods you find suitable for meeting together?

I am looking forward to hearing from you.

Onwards!

— sasha

item.title: 20161202 UT MAT157/MAT240: Study Session VII
item.dc:creator: umu
item.description:
Team,

I hope you are ready for the productive end of the week.

Today the plan is to meet at 16:10 in room 4010, Bahen, as usual, and discuss all the exciting questions you might have – and come up with them as well!

Hope to see you soon.

Onwards!

– sasha

item.title: 20161125 UT MAT157/MAT240 Study Session VI: Addendum
item.dc:creator: umu
item.description:
Team,

I am grateful to all of you who have come today. In the session we were happy to welcome Janice in our circle!

With regards to the problem that Saminul suggested, the following are several links which I hope you might find interesting:

(1) Generalization of the Polynomial Factorization to Matrices

(2) Proof that Every Operator over a Finite-dimensional Complex Vector Space has an Eigenvalue

Have a great weekend!

– sasha

item.title: 20161125 UT MAT157/MAT240 Study Session VI
item.dc:creator: umu
item.description:
Team,

I hope you are having a productive week.

Today we plan to meet at 16:10 at an unusual place – room 4010 in Bahen.

I have also added a book on the treatment of linear algebra via exterior products to the resource page on ut.umu.

If you know some interesting applications of MVT, intuitive visualizations of dual spaces or stories about Diogenes and his friends, you are more than welcome to share them with us.

Hope to see you there.

Onwards!

– sasha

item.title: 20161118 UT MAT157/MAT240: Study Session V
item.dc:creator: umu
item.description:
Team,

I am writing to remind you that today the session is going to take place at the usual time, 16:10, in the usual place, B026 (seminar room), Bahen.

The preliminary plan is to split the session into two, one for analysis and one for algebra, but if you have any other ideas in mind, please do not hesitate to propose them during the session. And it would be great to hear any problems or questions you might want to discuss together!

Good luck to all of you who have a midterm today.

Onwards!

– sasha

item.title: 20161113 UT MAT157: Preparation for Midterm Test
item.dc:creator: umu
item.description:
Team,

I hope you are having a productive and reinvigorating weekend.

You may find the following past MAT157 exams worthwhile to look at for the midterm tomorrow:

  • MAT157 2002-2003 Midterm 2
  • MAT157 2003-2004 Midterm 2
  • MAT157 2004-2005 Midterm 2

I have also updated the ut.umu page with the advice from Özgür Esentepe and the photo from the last session on Friday, November 11. I am grateful to all of you for your dedication and creative boldness.

Onwards!

– sasha

item.title: 20161110 UT MAT157/MAT240: Preparation for Session IV
item.dc:creator: umu
item.description:
Team,

I hope you are having a productive week.

This is to remind you that this Friday we are going to have a session in the usual place, BA026, seminar room, Bahen, at 16:10.

I am aware that some people may have a test tomorrow, so it is understandable if you choose to miss a session.

I would be really grateful if you could think about what you want to do to spend it productively. For RA, Joe have recommended the following problems from Spivak:

pp. 108-110: #3, 7, 8, 11, 12, 19;

p. 120: #4, 9, 10;

pp. 130-131: #2, 5, 8, 10, 11;

p. 139: #1, 2;

pp. 163-165: #1, 11, 16;

pp. 182-183: #4, 8, 9

If you had finished those, it would be great to hear your suggestions.

To avoid misunderstanding, the session is planned to be split into two, and, as usual, you get separate CCR points for attending both parts. However, if you think it is useful to have a (l)ong session just devoted to RA, please send me a short email saying "l" in the subject or body.

On top of that, I would also like to remind you that Joe is holding a review session today, November 10, in Bahen 6180 from 15:00 to 16:00.

I am looking forward to hearing from you.

Onwards,

– sasha

item.title: 20161103 UT MAT157/MAT240: Friday Session Vote Results
item.dc:creator: umu
item.description:
Team,

I am writing to inform you about the results of the questionnaire.

Out of 7 people whose responses I have received, 6 individuals have confirmed their availability on Friday, and all of those 6 have chosen the talks. Thus, the plan is to go to the talks.

Considering the last two days of exciting events in the Fields Institute, I would be happy to hear the opinions and reflections from all of you who have managed to join the Bhargavalia. Moreover, if you are really excited about all the mathemagic you have witnessed and want to share the oumph with your knowledge-thirsty peers, we can devote one of the next sessions, perhaps after the analysis midterm, to your findings.

I am looking forwards to seeing you in BA2135 at 4:00 pm on Friday.

Onwards!

– sasha
